Verbiage: Your best friend invited you a concert to see your favorite artist, tickets are $125! Do you want to go with them?
It's your anniversary! You can spend an extra $100 and take your significant other to their favorite restaurant, would you like to treat them to their favorite meal?
Your favorite football team is coming to town to play the Giants. Tickets are $175, do you want to go to the game?
Your favorite basketball team is coming to town and playing in Madison Square Garden. Tickets are $150, do you want to go to the game?
Your best friend is having there bachelor(ette) party. The hotel room and travel is $200. Do you want to attend the partt?
It's your best friends birthday, dinner and drinks will cost you $100. Would you like to attend the party?
A new pair of Yeezy's dropped this month and you have the rare opportunity to purchase them for $200. Do you want to buy them?
The new spiderman video game dropped this month, and the reviews say it is the best game of the year. You can purchase the game for $65 on Amazon. Do you want to buy it?

Item: Going for drinking to a pub
Verbiage: Your friends are going for a drink at a pub. You can join them, but rounds will cost you $75. Do you want to go to the pub?
Your backpack is getting old and the padding on the laptop sleeve lost it's cushion. You can purchase a new backpack for $75. Do you want to purchase a new backpack?
It's date night! if you buy dinner for your date it will cost you an extra $50. Do you want to pay for dinner?
It's Prime Day on Amazon! All the deals are so amazing, you can get an echo dot and a bunch of other stuff for $175. Do you want to spend on Prime Day?
Your winter jacket is 3 years old, and the threads are starting to fray. You can buy a new one on sale for $250, or stick with the old one for another year. Do you want to buy a new jacket?
You're attending a friend's wedding, you can stay in the hotel with the wedding party or a cheaper hotel and save $200. Do you want to stay in the more expensive hotel?
You're buying groceries for the month, you can go to a discount grocery store and save $100 or you can buy your groceries from Whole Foods. Do you want to buy groceries from Whole Foods?
All of your friends are splitting a table at the club, you can go out with them, and chip in $175, or stay home. Do you want to go to the club?
Your airpods broke. You can use your old apple headphones or buy a new pair for $135. Do you want to buy a new pair?
